column4: is there anyway to force apt-get to remove packages? despite if the packages are broken?
i can't install the broken packages with sudo apt-get -f install
could you paste the output to pastebin?
sure
o.o... i fixed it with Synaptic
http://pastebin.com/m272a3957
try `sudo apt-get clean`
tried that
i tried to install gnome
try removing gnome-network-preferences first, then doing apt-get install -f
didn't work either...
sweet
one way to resolve it is just persist through the dependencies, removing them all until it lets you remove what you want, then reinstalling them after it's resolved
but the goal is to remove the package with the offending file, then run apt-get install -f
so there's no way to get apt-get to forgot all about installing gnome?
it's probably bugging you for good reason :)
:P but i want it just to forget it
pingu i686 ;)
thanks for the help ;)
no problemo, synaptic is smarter than me though :[
synaptic is going to rule the world
